Name_2: Do you have webworms in your gardens?
Text_2:
With summer ending it seems even trees are getting in the spooky spirit with cloth-like netting covering their leaves and branches.

But those webs aren't from spiders. Fall webworms are moth caterpillars that are native to North America.

Webworms can typically be seen later in the summer munching on a whole variety of deciduous trees such as maple elm and poplar. For the most part they aren't picky bugs.

Unlike other caterpillars webworms like to live in large communities.

After hatching the larvae they will stay together in a community to build a large web nest to use as shelter.

"It protects them from things like birds and ants and other predators that might affect them" said entomologist Ilan Domnich.

LISTEN |

Because the nest is so tightly wound the temperature inside them is high which increases the metabolism of the worms and speeds up their development.

The webworm will go through six different stages as a caterpillar staying close to the tent and only venturing out to eat.

"That's when people will notice defoliation in the trees when those big caterpillars are eating lots of leaves" Domnich said.

Do webworms cause damage to the trees?

Webworms don't always damage the trees.

If you get a normal webworm population they may eat all the leaves off of a tree Domnich said.

"The tree won't be very happy but it'll be just fine. Next year it will grow all new leaves" he said.

However if the webworm population comes back year after year trees could get stressed out and eventually die.

"But that will typically only happen when you get these huge outbreak populations" Domnich said.

The worms go through cycles where there's just a few of them around and next year they're everywhere.

How can you treat webworms?

One way to treat webworms is by using pesticide one that specifically targets caterpillars so as to reduce harm to other types of insects.

"All the other bugs everything that's eating the bugs the birds and everything like that it's all part of the same ecosystem" Domnich said.

Following the rules and guidelines for pesticide spraying is very important Domnich said.

"You never spray when it's going to rain because it's just going to wash out" he said.

Similarly you never spray during the middle of the day when pollinators are active.

Another way to control the caterpillars Domnich said is to simply pick them up and throw them away.

Yearly webworm outbreaks can cause stress to the tree and eventually kill it but that's not always the case. (Ishita Verma/CBC)

"The best way to get rid of them is just to use ... a garden fork or those forks you use for roasting hot dogs and just reach up into the web and twirl it like you're picking up spaghetti and just pull the web out of the the tree" Mike Jenkins pest management coordinator for the City of Edmonton told CBC's Radio Active.

Webworms don't have itchy hairs and they also don't bite making them safe to grab.

"Or remove the cocoons if you see those" Domnich said.

The cocoons are spun out of silk and look like a big fuzzy pill about an inch long.

Once in the cocoon the caterpillars fall to the ground pupate over the winter and hatch out as moths in the spring.

While the image of worms in a web nest can be gross and slightly off-putting webworms are a great food source for birds and are an important part of the ecosystem Domnich said.
Name_3: Emerald Ash Borer damage more than just ash trees
Text_3:
Where are your blind spots? In a car these are the spots that you cannot see when turning or backing up. Fancy cameras and screens are being used to help drivers see their blind spots. But no camera can cure a mental blind spot and the effects of that are everywhere. We often don‚Äôt see the things that we haven‚Äôt trained our brains to see.

There is a famous video of a group of people watching dancers onstage. A man walks through them in a bear costume but no one notices because they are so focused on the dancers. The human mind is capable of such focus that it is possible to not see something really obvious.

One of those disconcerting moments happened to me one past summer as I talked to Cornell entomologist Jason Dombroskie who was collecting moths at Audubon as part of a research project to identify the moths of New York.

My knowledge of moths is limited to identifying only a couple dozen species of the hundreds that are out there. Some are easy to identify most are put into my mental ‚Äúsmall gray moth‚Äù category and ignored.

I was rather proud of myself when I could identify some of the moths that he had found since the odds of him finding one of the few I know were slim. One of these was the Waved Sphinx moth. These gray moths are masters of camouflage but have distinctive wavy black lines and a white eye-shaped dot on the wing that make it one that I recognize.

‚ÄúThis moth is in danger of going extinct‚Äù Dombroskie said. This news came as a complete shock to me but it shouldn‚Äôt have. The answer to why was lurking in my blind spot hiding in plain sight amongst all the facts that I knew but hadn‚Äôt put together yet.

Waved Sphinx moth caterpillars mostly eat Ash trees though there is evidence that they will eat oak and privet as well. Ash trees are slowly but surely disappearing from the region with the spread of a tiny green insect called the Emerald Ash Borer (EAB). This insect bores into the ash tree and kills it within a year or so. As the main food source for the caterpillar dwindles the moth may disappear as well.

According to the journal ‚ÄúBiological Invasions‚Äù there are forty-three species that depend on ash trees and may disappear. Some are moths like the Waved Sphinx and others are lesser known insects that feed on the leaves seeds and bark of ash trees. These species only feed on ash and not other plants similar to how Monarch caterpillars only eat milkweed.

The study noted 282 species that use ash trees. Of these 208 are at a low risk for going extinct. Thirteen are at a medium risk and 17 are at a high-moderate risk of extinction that join into the 44 at high risk.

For me that was a pretty big blind spot. At Audubon we treated the ash trees in the Ted Grisez Arboretum to keep the Emerald Ash Borers from killing them. My thoughts never went beyond the tragic loss of a tree species to wonder at the loss of other species that could disappear with them.

If the disappearance of ash trees from the landscape could wipe out other species did that happen in the past? A quick search revealed that the chestnut blight of the twentieth century took out at least five species of moth and a weevil as well as billions of American Chestnut trees. While scientists are working on helping the trees make a comeback the insects that disappeared with the majority of the chestnuts are gone for good.

When an insect goes extinct when the plant it depends on disappears it is called co-extinction. While the American Chestnut did not go extinct it became scarce enough that many of the insects that depended on it disappeared.

This was my blind spot. As I figure out how to get dead ash trees safely down or buy ash firewood that is popping up in people‚Äôs yards I never thought to look at the ripple effect of a tree‚Äôs disappearance. It affects insects and through them other animals whose lives revolve around a tree threatened by an Asian insect brought here by accident.

It‚Äôs a pretty big blind spot and one that I was glad to have pointed out. One of the hardest things to do is think of all the consequences of human actions. It never occurred to me that I would have to mourn the loss of moths that disappeared with the ash or that there were species I would never see because of the disappearance of the American Chestnut. It puts everything in a different light and even if there is little I can do to stop it I can still stop and pay attention to the loss of a species.

They are looking for ash trees that are resistant to EAB. They are popping up here and there. With luck in ten years I will not be writing a eulogy for the insects that died with their only food source.

Audubon Community Nature Center builds and nurtures connections between people and nature. ACNC is located just east of Route 62 between Warren and Jamestown. The trails are open from dawn to dusk as is Liberty the Bald Eagle and the Ted Grisez Arboretum a living museum of local trees. The Nature Center is open from 10 a.m. until 4:30 p.m. daily except Sunday when it opens at 1 p.m. More information can be found online at auduboncnc.org or by calling 716-569-2345.

Name: CH Robinson
Name_1: Bangladeshi higher degree research gently weeps
Text_1:
Research is an intimate engagement with the topic with an area of investigation. A researcher lives with the subject matter during their research period. It is an organic relationship between the research subject and the researcher. There is no doubt that research can be arduous in its undertaking; however it can be rewarding in the end.

In the Bangladeshi education system we come to be familiar with the term "research" at the tertiary level of education sometimes even after that i.e. during higher degree research such as MPhil or PhD.

It is quite unlikely for Bangladeshi primary or high school students to understand the meaning of the word "research" though some English medium schools are promoting research-based assignments activities and projects at school and hence they orient their students to research.

The departments across the Bangladeshi public universities that do not engage their students in their higher studies with any sort of research activities do harm to them in different ways.

First research is one of the primary missions of higher-education institutions like universities. A university accommodates the spirit of new knowledge formation its preservation and dissemination and research is a pedagogical mandate to meet this end.

If an educational entity aspires to the educational ideal of a university it must include a graded research assignment for its students. Without any research experience in their home university/department our Bangladeshi students often find it difficult to pursue the rigorous research demand in the Global North or in any higher degree institutions where a high standard of research is maintained.

To my knowledge the Department of English at the University of Chittagong has not yet included any research project or dissertation in its curriculum after almost 60 years of its inception. Such academic indifference does injustice to the bright students who intend to pursue higher degrees/studies. As a result we often lose many budding scholars.

Second research has effective consequences on our personality. Just as Francis Bacon referred to different disciplines as a remedy to our intellectual and characteristic needs research impacts our personality if taken and undertaken seriously and ethically.

While pursuing research a researcher must be patient assiduous and focused ‚Äî three characteristics that have a pragmatic impact on our personality and behaviour.

A good researcher tends to refrain from being judgemental and making hasty assumptions. The cognitive attention that a researcher invests in their work turns them into a curious investigator and keen observer of what happens around them.

Now the question is what impacts a researcher's research experience. Let's consider a few issues that impact a researcher's experience conducting research.

First and foremost is the research infrastructure and the research culture of an institution and/or department/school. In terms of global research impact indicators our universities and institutions have been struggling to level themselves to the international standard and the struggle goes on.

Why so? One of the prime reasons may be that we have not yet been able to create a research infrastructure. Having MRes (MA by research) MPhil or PhD programmes does not necessarily ensure a research infrastructure. The question is how these programmes are run and what institutional amenities we offer to the researchers to quench their scholarly thirst.

How many updated databases do our researchers get access to in order to be familiar with the more recent research findings or how many conferences seminars and workshops do we organise for our post-graduates to participate in?

How many research networks do we engage our researchers in? Do our researchers get proper guidelines regarding research conduct and progress? Do we help our researchers during or after their research i.e. during- or post-research publication? Do our supervisors or institutional higher degree infrastructure organise enough training sessions or workshops for the ECRs (Early Career Researchers) MCRs (Mid-Career Researchers) or researchers without any prior research exposure? The answer to this set of questions is quite frustrating.

In Bangladesh due to historical academic indifference towards research students undertaking research projects often find themselves helpless and at a loss. It's not that they are incapable just that they need some guidance about the research trajectory.

Doing academic research is a lone journey. Hence institutions and supervisors can be and should be the best support for the researchers.

Quite a few researchers working in Bangladeshi higher degree institutions drop out before completing the degree the reason being scared and not getting enough support from their peers and supervisors.

Three-year PhDs finishing in 6-8 years is a common perception about the Bangladeshi higher degree structure. Such a "session jam" is often caused by supervisory negligence; however the students' personal inconvenience and irregularity also come into such delays.

I personally know a few scholars who started their PhD in some reputed Bangladeshi universities and after 3-4 years they quit with utter frustration from not having enough academic support from the doctoral cohort or the institutions. Not being able to exorcise an uncanny fear about research often leads students to procrastinate and sometimes quit.

Procrastination be it institutional or personal has a risk too. For example the research topic someone is lingering on due to institutional or supervisory sluggishness might be taken up (knowingly or not) and completed/published by somebody else or some other institution before the researcher who initiated it first completes it.

Hence that researcher might need to change their topic which often poses a big psychological pressure on the researcher. Moreover procrastination may breed demotivation and intellectual disconnectedness. Sometimes even the supervisors don't even realise the question of the well-being and work-life balance of the researchers.

That leads to a crucial question of whether the supervisor themselves have a high degree of research experience. This question has an ethical dimension to it.

For instance can someone without a high degree (experience) supervise an MPhil or a PhD? Or should the same person be a member of the very powerful Higher Studies Committee of any entity? The answer is ‚Äîethically no; but in Bangladesh yes.

Do the research students have access to any space or mechanism to raise their voices regarding the qualification of their supervisors? No. Or even if yes the consequence has its psychological toll on the research students.

When it comes to ethical considerations in conducting and disseminating the research our students often find it an alien issue. What does ethics have to do with research? Well to put it simply just as plagiarism is an ethical issue in publication our methods of data collection might have a very serious impact on the research participants.

For example doing research with human participants might have a serious economic social and medical impact on them. To flesh it out more if I collect research data from a marginalised group of research participants my act of data collection might expose them to worse vulnerabilities. This is one of the reasons why we raise our voices against the capitalist pharmaceutical industries for their alleged clinical trials on the impoverished people of the Global South.

The only ethical guidelines for conducting research with human subjects available in Bangladesh is the one outlined by Bangladesh Medical Research Council (BMRC). However there are not any such ethical guidelines available on a national level or at the university level. Therefore whenever our researchers pursue research in collaboration with any Global North universities they must comply with their ethical guidelines.

We can start thinking about how to utilise the research outcomes of our researchers in national development. As academic and academic administrators it is our responsibility to create career opportunities for our researchers; otherwise like most of our PhD thesis the afterlife of research of our students will be the dusty corners of the libraries.

A massive restructuring of our research parameters and ensuring accountability and ethical conduct of research will not only embolden our academic structure but also help us create generations of responsible scholars.

The author is an Associate Professor (on leave) at the Department of English Jahangirnagar University. He is currently a PhD researcher & Postgraduate representative at the School of Law Society & Criminology UNSW Sydney.

Name_2: Utica school buses expected to run on time this year
Text_2:
Utica school students ‚Äîand charter and parochial school students ‚Äî should get to school on time this year officials from the district‚Äôs bus company predicted.

Durham School Services the district‚Äôs bus contractor was four drivers short of the 125 drivers needed to cover the district‚Äôs planned 125 routes according to a memo from the district‚Äôs Transportation Supervisor Zachary Nicotera to school board members following his meeting with Durham officials on Tuesday.

But Durham has five drivers who may be ready to hit the road on the first day or soon after and it‚Äôs bringing two drivers in from the Schenectady area where the company has extra drivers the memo said. And the company should have enough drivers for all 125 routes within the first few weeks of school officials have said.

‚ÄúAll schools are routed‚Äù said Edward Flavin vice president of external communications for National Express Durham‚Äôs parent company. ‚ÄúWe are making minor adjustments to a few routes to cover all routes assigned until the last few positions are filled. We don‚Äôt expect any routes to go uncovered or operate anywhere near last year.‚Äù

That‚Äôs a big change from last year when Durham started out in September with only 62 drivers a local manifestation of a national school bus driver shortage. The company never got a full contingent of drivers during the 2021-22 school year its first year of operation in Utica. As a result many students arrived late for schools others got picked up late after school and some were left standing at their bus stops.

2021-22 school year:Bus company: Driver shortages leading to Utica school bus delays threats from parents

2021-22 school year:Utica school buses still running late but company still says it expects progress

The Utica Academy of Science Charter School pushed back its start time which was too early for buses that dropped off Utica city school students first. But students still frequently arrived late ‚Äï often considerably late ‚Äï throughout the year staff said.

But Hanka Grabovica regional student affairs officer said communication and cooperation with the district is better this year.

‚ÄúAs of now everything looks good and the way it should be‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAll of our students received a bus schedule of picking and dropping them off. Now we just have to wait and see how everything will work out.‚Äù School board members questioned Durham officials following a presentation on the driver situation at the board‚Äôs August meeting. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm very concerned‚Äù Vice President Donald Dawes said ‚Äúabout kids being on a corner somewhere and not being picked up. ‚Ä¶ I was waiting all last year to hear that everyone was being picked up and I‚Äôm still waiting.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre getting very close‚Äù Brett Wester regional manager told him ‚Äúto a good position. ‚Ä¶ Where we‚Äôre at is manageable.‚Äù

School bus driver positions consistently difficult to fill

Districts across the state have been struggling to fill all kinds of positions within their schools this summer but bus drivers and substitute teachers have consistently been the hardest to fill according to the New York State Council of School Superintendents. Yet Durham has significantly increased its numbers.

Although the company is still a few drivers short officials think they‚Äôll have enough drivers on the first day of school to pick up students on time and more drivers after the first week or two of school Other details of plans include:

The district and the company will pool staff to make sure that all routes and after-school sports meets have drivers.

‚ÄúMop-up‚Äù buses stationed around Utica will pick up any students who get missed for some reason.

Durham has several drivers expected to be cleared any day: one who took the road test on Tuesday two waiting for medical clearance and two full licensed drivers who recently applied.

The district has been able to remove 113 students from bus routes because their parents have promised to drive them.

Newly elected board member James Paul is optimistic based on Durham‚Äôs work to recruit train and license drivers its cooperation with the district‚Äôs transportation department and its monthly updates to the board.

‚ÄúI believe‚Äù he said ‚Äúthat our students and families will see a substantial improvement in our transportation department.‚Äù

And the situation should keep getting better Durham officials stressed. Another eight to 10 drivers should be ready for the road in the next week or two Flavin said. Another 27 drivers are somewhere in the training pipeline Wester said.

The company is also still hiring to make sure it has enough substitutes and drivers for extracurricular activities.

Durham has made several changes this year that have helped it hire and retain more drivers Flavin said such as a 12.1 percent wage increase referral bonuses of between $500 and $1000 extensive advertising and publicity and a streamlined process for recruiting and training workers.

And the local Department of Motor Vehicles offices have stepped up he said to make sure candidates can get permitted and tested in a reasonable timeframe.

When Durham won the contract for the Utica schools one selling point was an app that lets parents track their child‚Äôs bus in real time. But with all the driver difficulties last year the app didn‚Äôt work.

But Durham plans on starting up its Bus Tracker app to show parents their children‚Äôs bus‚Äô estimated time of arrival once all the routes are firmly set hopefully in October Flavin said.

The app will also help the company let parents know about any busing issues he said.

Reporter Amy Neff Roth covers issues that affect families. Contact her at aroth@uticaod.com.

Name: Chevron Corporation
Name_1: Chevron Lobbies for Expanded Venezuela Oil License
Text_1:
The multinational corporation needs permission from the US Treasury Department to ramp up its activities in Venezuela.

Caracas September 4 2022 (venezuelanalysis.com) ‚Äì US oil giant Chevron has reportedly applied for a broader license for its Venezuela operations.

With the Venezuelan economy and the oil sector in particular under heavy unilateral sanctions from the US Treasury Department all activities involving the Caribbean nation require special permission from Washington.

Chevron has a minimal license that runs out in November allowing the company to perform maintenance on its wells but not drill process or trade in Venezuelan crude. The company was forced to wind down its operations in 2020.

According to Reuters the California-based corporation is looking for an expanded sanctions waiver that will see it take greater control in joint ventures with Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA as well as ramp up production and resume sales of Venezuelan crude.

In May Chevron received permission to hold direct talks with PDVSA on kickstarting its activities. The two companies co-own four ventures with a total crude production capacity of about 200000 barrels per day (bpd).

Reuters claimed that the multinational oil firm is pushing for a crude-for-diluents swap that will boost production at the Petropiar crude upgrader. It also wants greater control over the ventures‚Äô operations human resources and oil trading while using sales to offset a reported $3 billion owed by PDVSA.

The revamped operations would not involve changing the stakeholding structure at the joint enterprises. Chevron has between 25 and 40 percent shares in its Venezuela ventures while the country‚Äôs legislation demands that PDVSA be the majority shareholder in all oil projects.

For its part Caracas has stated that ‚Äúthe ball is in the US‚Äô court‚Äù concerning an expansion of Chevron‚Äôs activities.

‚ÄúWe are ready. We have discussed and agreed with them everything related to the immediate restitution of operations. But it no longer depends on us‚Äù Venezuelan Oil Minister Tareck El Aissami said in a press conference.

Since 2017 Washington has levied a string of measures against the Venezuelan oil sector including financial sanctions an oil embargo and secondary sanctions. The US Treasury Department also blocked swap agreements while targeting and threatening international agents against dealing with the South American country.

The wide-reaching sanctions triggered a collapse of the country‚Äôs oil output which went from 1.9 million bpd before the 2017 measures all the way down to historic lows under 400000 bpd in the second half of 2020. Production bounced back but has been stuck around 700000 bpd for several months.

Both the Trump and Biden administrations have ignored widespread condemnation of the economic blockade. Multilateral organizations UN human rights rapporteurs solidarity groups and even US Democrat House members have called on the White House to undo the measures that have been classed as ‚Äúcollective punishment.‚Äù

However the global energy crisis triggered by the conflict in Ukraine saw Biden reengage with the Maduro administration.

Administration officials have claimed Washington is looking to encourage the Venezuelan government to re-open talks with the hardline opposition. While there has been little movement in that direction the US Treasury Department granted oil-for-debt licenses to Italy‚Äôs ENI and Spain‚Äôs Repsol in a bid to help European allies tackle fuel shortages and rising costs.

The two corporations carried several cargoes in June and July before shipments were reportedly suspended as PDVSA looks to expand the swaps and receive fuel as well.

Name_2: AFL-CIO official says unions are gaining strength
Text_2:
As Americans honor the labor movement and the contributions of workers this Labor Day weekend AFL-CO Secretary/Treasurer Fred Redmond says unions are gaining strength and numbers through an unprecedented nationwide grassroots movement.

Redmond was in Detroit on Friday to meet with local union officials and to prepare for the kickoff of the AFL-CIO‚Äôs new Permission to Dream program later this month. Redmond who has an extensive work history in the steel industry said what he observes right now is unlike anything he has seen previously in the labor movement.

‚ÄúI never remember a moment like this‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúWhat is happening is very organic and at a grassroots level. Workers are independently standing up and we embrace that but we are also here to assist them and guide them through the process.‚Äù

The AFL-CIO is a voluntary federation of 57 national and international labor unions representing more than 12.5 million workers. Redmond said that number is growing in part due to the unionization of workers in industries that have been traditionally non-union. Retail restaurant and healthcare are just three areas where unions have experienced a surge of popularity.

Last month a Lansing Chipotle Mexican Grill became the first of the chain‚Äôs 3000 locations to unionize. Earlier this year 10 Michigan Starbucks locations ‚Äî including one in Clinton Township ‚Äî voted to unionize joining more than 130 Starbucks nationwide whose workers have organized.

‚ÄúThroughout the COVID pandemic workers in many industries realized they were the cog in the wheel that was driving business‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúDuring the pandemic grocery workers were treated as essential workers but once we started moving back toward normality workers were being treated as if they were expendable. Workers have realized that the best way for them to have a voice is through collective action.‚Äù

Workers are not just seeking higher wages they are concerned about workplace safety and work/life balance as well.

‚ÄúWhat is driving this movement is that workers are feeling disrespected‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúPeople are working an enormous amount of hours. We have teachers who feel threatened at work. Workers are at the point where they are fed up and are resigning in huge numbers. They‚Äôre not just looking for sufficient wages but things like child care paid leave and a consistent schedule.‚Äù

Redmond said the AFL-CIO is also working to bring workers from the alternative energy sector into the organized labor fold.

‚ÄúThere has been an expansion of wind turbine energy and solar power industries because of the effort to reduce emissions‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúThese industries tend to pay low wages and have limited benefits and we would like to see the expansion of the union in these industries.‚Äù

He noted the UAW is working to establish its footprint in the electric vehicle industry as that becomes a bigger piece of the automotive industry as a whole.

‚ÄúThe UAW is at the table making progress and figuring out how they are going to operate in the future‚Äù said Redmond.

He has been disappointed by the extreme push back received from some businesses where workers are trying to organize unions. In his mind companies that do that misunderstand the goal of unions.

‚ÄúCollaboration is powerful and I think a lot of companies are missing the point‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúIt is not our mission to destroy jobs or destroy the company profit margin it is about workers having a voice. When we have a voice we accomplish things.

‚ÄúBoth sides can sit down and discuss safety on the job and fair pay and fair work schedules in a way that is going to be sustainable for both the employee and the company.‚Äù

While disagreements between organized labor and employers are not unusual compromise happens at the bargaining table.

‚ÄúWe may disagree on some issues but we share the goal of making sure the company is profitable enough to provide good jobs to the community‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúThe resistance we are seeing to organized labor from some companies particularly in the retail sector I believe to be related to corporate greed.‚Äù

Later this month Redmond will be back in Detroit to kick off the AFL-CIO‚Äôs Permission to Dream program that helps high school seniors have access to apprenticeship opportunities with local unions. There will be apprenticeships available for future plumbers electricians millwrights just to name a few.

Permission to Dream is meant to help raise the high school graduation rate for minorities by offering an alternative to costly traditional college education. The average rate of high school graduation for Black students in the United States is 77.5% compared to 89.2% for White students and 93.6% for Asian students.

‚ÄúIt is about putting students on a career path especially those in certain communities where they have felt locked out‚Äù said Redmond.

Redmond was elected to his position in June 2022 and is the highest ranking Black officer in the history of the American labor movement. AFL-CIO President Liz Schuler is the first female leader of the organization.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited about the future and the direction of the labor movement‚Äù said Redmond. ‚ÄúWe are trying to recognize the realities of diversity in the work force and help everyone find their voice in the movement.‚Äù
Name_3: Kevin Bacon joins viral 'It's Corn' trend
Text_3:
Kevin Bacon has added some star power to the viral ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Corn‚Äô phenomenon picking up his guitar for a‚Ä¶ corny‚Ä¶ rendition of the song.

In a video posted to Instagram the actor performed an acoustic cover of the song soulfully singing the annoyingly catchy lyrics while strumming his guitar with a corn on the cob.

Bacon finishes the song taking a bite of the corn saying ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs corn.‚Äù

The ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Corn‚Äô phenomenon began with web channel Recess Therapy interviewing a kid called Tariq about his favourite food.

The interview contained many meme-worthy quips from the six-year-old.

Soon enough The Gregory Brothers‚Äô Songify This made Tariq go even more viral by turning his interview into a catchy song.

The meme-making quips have soundtracked over 400000 TikTok videos. The official music video released last Sunday has already had over 2.1 million views on YouTube.

Watch the official ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Corn‚Äô music video:

‚ÄúFor me I really like corn‚Äù Tariq says in the video.

‚ÄúWhat do you like about corn?‚Äù host Julian Shapiro-Barnum asks.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs corn! A big lump with knobs‚Ä¶ it has the juice‚Äù Tariq explains. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt imagine a more beautiful thing.‚Äù

The song has gone so viral in fact the official TikTok account of TikTok has changed it‚Äôs bio to read ‚Äúit‚Äôs CORN.‚Äù

It isn‚Äôt the first time the Gregory Brothers have taken a viral moment and made it musical.

The family band of Michael Evan Sarah Fullen and Andrew Gregory are responsible for some of the biggest viral songs of the past decade.

Their ‚ÄòBed Intruder Song‚Äô which featured a news interview with Antoine Dodson ended up becoming the most watched YouTube video of 2010.

NPR explored the group‚Äôs continued success this week.

‚ÄúI think our videos are really about finding amazing moments on the Internet and celebrating them and amplifying them‚Äù Andrew Gregory said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre about highlighting other people‚Äôs interviews original words. And I think that is what has given our videos staying power.‚Äù

Tariq has even lent his viral power to Mexican grill chain Chipotle who created their most popular ad yet starring the ‚Äúcorn kid‚Äù.
Name_4: What Kind Of Food Is Chipotle? (Explained)
Text_4:
At some point many people have had Chipotle.

With a small menu consisting of Mexican-style food it can sound like traditional Mexican food but it has left many people confused.

Whether you are a regular at Chipotle or thinking about trying it for the first time you might be wondering what type of food Chipotle is.

Here is everything you need to know about Chipotle and what kind of food they serve.

What Kind Of Food Is Chipotle?

Chipotle is considered a Mexican-American restaurant.

It may seem like a Mexican restaurant with a limited menu of burritos bowls salads and tacos.

However Chipotle is thought of as a fast restaurant and is often referred to as Mexican-inspired with an American influence as it has no real roots in Mexican culture or cuisine.

Chipotle is not considered authentic Mexican food.

They use similar spice profiles and in general they serve Mexican-style dishes such as tacos and burritos.

However Chipotle is still considered an American restaurant.

Those who are familiar with authentic Mexican food would not consider Chipotle authentic Mexican and would think of it as Mexican-inspired.

If you are looking for authentic Mexican food then Chipotle would not be the restaurant of choice.

What Is The Difference Between Chipotle And Mexican Food?

Although Chipotle is Mexican-inspired there are key differences between Chipotle and authentic Mexican food.

If you are seeking traditional Mexican food you will notice that Chipotle is not the same.

The types of tortillas used are very different in authentic Mexican food and Chipotle.

Chipotle does not use homemade tortillas.

They typically use flour tortillas for tacos whereas traditional Mexican food uses corn tortillas for their tacos.

Chipotle does offer hard-shell corn tortillas which is common in authentic Mexican food.

When making traditional Mexican food they will use Cotija or Queso Blanco cheese but Chipotle uses shredded Cheddar or shredded Monterey Jack cheese.

Many of the sauces used in traditional Mexican food involve complex ingredients but Chipotle has simplified these so they are quick and easy to make.

Therefore they are not exactly like the sauces and salsas that are used in authentic Mexican food.

Is Chipotle Considered Fast Food?

Some people might refer to Chipotle as fast food but it is not fast food.

In the restaurant industry Chipotle is called fast casual.

This means that it is quick and convenient like fast food but it also offers the environment and quality of a sit-down restaurant.

You may hear Chipotle referred to as fast food or healthy fast food but it is technically not a fast food restaurant due to the dine-in experience that they offer.

It appeals to many people because you can use it as a fast food restaurant if you are wanting a quick meal but you can also dine in if you would rather take your time and eat in the restaurant.

Does Chipotle Serve Processed Food?

Chipotle is not considered processed food.

Their menu is simple and almost all of the food they offer is not processed or minimally processed.

They are proud to offer healthy alternatives to many fast food restaurants while not sacrificing flavor.

They gained nationwide attention by becoming the first national restaurant brand to no longer use added colors flavors or preservatives in their food.

Unlike many companies Chipotle released an ingredient statement that allows customers to view the specific ingredients in each food item they offer.

What Is The Best Thing To Order At Chipotle?

Everyone has different preferences for what they want to order at Chipotle.

Many people would argue that their personal favorite is the best thing to order.

However certain menu items have been more popular than others over the years.

One of the top menu items at Chipotle is the Barbacoa tacos.

Many people prefer to get them with a soft shell tortilla and minimal ingredients to make them truer to authentic Mexican food.

Another popular menu item is a burrito bowl with chicken.

The bowls have become a must-have for many people especially those who want a healthier option.

It is a great way to still get the deliciousness of Chipotle while eating something on the lighter side.

Perhaps coming in as the most popular item on their menu is the carnitas burrito.

Chipotle has always been known for its large burritos and the warm fresh tortillas make all the difference.

Their burritos can be customized with anything you wish to add and for some people the burrito is their go-to menu option every time.

Does Chipotle Use Real Meat?

Yes Chipotle does use real meat.

The only meat that is not considered real meat is their sofritas which is a plant-based protein that can be ordered in place of meat for those people who are vegetarian.

However Chipotle received an ‚ÄúA‚Äù rating from the Chain Reaction III Report and Scorecard which bases its review on antibiotic use in farm animals.

This means that Chipotle is responsibly sourcing their meat and using real meat that has not been treated with antibiotics or added hormones and has been raised in more humane ways.

For those people who are very conscious about the quality of meat that they consume they will lean more towards choosing Chipotle when trying to find a quick option for food because they have worked hard to only serve good quality meat.

What Other Restaurants Are Similar To Chipotle?

If you do not have a Chipotle in your area there are food options that are very similar to Chipotle and will have similar menu choices.

Restaurants such as Qdoba Baja Fresh Rubio‚Äôs and Moe‚Äôs Southwest Grill all offer similar options to Chipotle at around the same price point.

Although these restaurants are not identical to Chipotle and will have different foods as well as flavors they do share similarities and are a great alternative for those who love Chipotle.

Is Chipotle Better Than Qdoba?

Chipotle and Qdoba have some similarities but some differences may have some people expressing a preference for one over the other.

Over the last few years Chipotle has emphasized its slogan ‚Äúfood for integrity.‚Äù

They have prided themselves on food that is raised humanely and non-GMO.

However Qdoba has made their tagline ‚ÄúWhat are you going to love at Qdoba?‚Äù which means that their variety of flavors and items will leave an option for everyone.

They do have a more extensive menu than Chipotle does.

When it comes to the infamous guacamole at Chipotle Qdoba has the upper hand because they do not charge extra for guacamole.

Chipotle has caught some grief for charging extra for guacamole in the past.

Chipotle previously came out with queso and it quickly was removed from their menu.

However Qdoba has queso that has been loved by many.

They seem to have come out on top with regard to the queso on the menu.

In the end Chipotle and Qdoba have similarities when it comes to menu items but it comes down to personal preference as to which restaurant is better.

Some people will prefer the simplicity of Chipotle and the fact that they are non-GMO as well as the fact that they use meat with no added hormones.

However others might prefer the additional options that Qdoba offers and want to be able to have more menu options.

Are Chipotle And Taco Bell Similar?

A common comparison that is made between restaurants is people comparing Chipotle to Taco Bell.

However these two restaurants are vastly different.

Chipotle has a very limited menu compared to the very extensive Taco Bell menu.

Chipotle is going to be closer to authentic Mexican food than Taco Bell will.

Taco Bell is also considered a fast food restaurant whereas Chipotle is fast casual with the option to have a traditional sit-down dining experience.

Chipotle also uses all fresh ingredients with no added hormones but Taco Bell has never made a statement that says they do the same.

Overall the restaurants differ greatly and would not be considered similar.

Is Chipotle Still Owned By McDonald‚Äôs?

Those who are familiar with Chipotle and the background behind the company have probably heard about the involvement that McDonald‚Äôs had in the company.

However McDonald‚Äôs does not own Chipotle nor did they ever fully own the company.

When the company first began in the 1990s the founder Steve Ells needed some financial backing to help fund the company‚Äôs expansion.

It began as a small company in Denver Colorado.

McDonald‚Äôs took a minority stake in the company and invested in helping to expand Chipotle.

However by the time Chipotle became a publicly traded company in 2006 Mcdonald‚Äôs owned approximately 90% of the company.

Eventually McDonald‚Äôs sold their share of the company due to some differences of opinion on how Chipotle should be run and organized.

McDonald‚Äôs no longer has any stake in the company and does not own Chipotle.

Is Chipotle Healthy?

Chipotle is considered one of the healthier options when it comes to faster dining.

This is due to their fresh ingredients that are free of additives.

However even though they are considered a healthier option it can be easy to add up the calories on a Chipotle order depending on what you add to your order and how much you plan to eat.

Their portion sizes can be large especially when it comes to their burritos as they can end up at around 1000 calories.

It is important to keep that in mind if you are working to get healthier or lose weight.

What Is The Healthiest Thing To Eat At Chipotle?

If you are concerned about what you are eating and want to pick the healthiest option at Chipotle then a salad or bowl would be your best option.

You can add your meat of choice rice and beans.

Those who are wanting to be extremely health conscious may choose brown rice and black or pinto beans.

As far as the healthiest toppings for your salad or bowl your best options are going to be fajita veggies guacamole and salsa.

Toppings that you might want to add sparingly will include queso cheese sour cream and chips.

Chipotle can be as healthy or unhealthy as you make it.

That is one thing that appeals to many people about Chipotle.

It is customizable and although the menu is limited many people can find something to suit what they are looking for.

What Has Made Chipotle So Successful?

Chipotle is very well known and also well loved by many.

With a limited menu and a fast-casual environment some people might be left wondering why Chipotle has become so successful compared to other similar restaurants.

1. Highly Customizable

Although the menu is limited there are so many options to customize your order at Chipotle.

Whether you are looking for a healthy salad or a burrito you have the option to put certain toppings on the food.

If you are vegetarian gluten-free or just have a preference you can surely find something on the menu that can be customized to your needs.

2. Limited Menu

The limited menu at Chipotle might be looked at as a downfall but it is in reality a key to the success of the company.

They have a very limited number of items on their menu as well as limited ingredients.

The less food that they have to purchase means less food spoilage and waste.

It also allows Chipotle to spend money on fresher and better-quality food.

3. High-Quality Food

Due to the limited number of ingredients Chipotle has emphasized fresh ingredients and sourcing food that has no added hormones as well as meat that has been raised humanely.

This is an added benefit to customers and has made them a sought-after restaurant for those that are more health conscious.

4. Quick Service

The limited menu has also contributed to quick service.

There are only a handful of items that customers can order so those who are preparing the food will not have as many menu items to cook.

This leads to the ability to serve customers quickly and efficiently which has contributed to the success of the restaurant.

Whether you order the food from the restaurant in person or online you are almost always guaranteed to get quick but excellent service.

5. Reasonable Prices

Chipotle is known for having larger portion sizes and many people often split a single meal into two meals which can make it more worthwhile for the cost.

Even after Chipotle has had to raise its prices on multiple occasions they have continued to become increasingly successful.

Customers have stated that they know they will get their money‚Äôs worth when ordering food from Chipotle.

Conclusion

Chipotle is a fast-casual Mexican-American restaurant.

With a limited menu and fresh ingredients it has become increasingly popular over the last several years.

Many people choose Chipotle as a go-to for not only a delicious meal but also an excellent choice for a healthier option even when you need something quick.

Name: Church & Dwight
Name_1: Stunning 125-year-old Catholic church faces the wrecking ball after parishioners struggled to raise $2m for re
Text_1:
A historic Catholic church faces imminent demolition if its parishioners aren't able to raise $2 million for repairs and maintenance.

Our Lady of Lourdes Church in Chicago has been around for 125 years and acted as the primary church for three surrounding neighborhoods of Ashland Avenue.

The church held its first mass in October 1892 and was physically moved in 1929.

It took the efforts of 50 men and their horses to pry the 10000 ton church from its foundation move it across the street and rotate it 90 degrees. According to a Chicago Ancestry site the church was moved at a 'foot a minute.'

'It is a magnificent historically and architecturally significant church' said church preservation advocate Julie Sawacki on the steps leading to the church's entrance. 'Imagine tearing something so significant down.'

The front fa√ßade of Our Lady of Lourdes Church in Chicago. The historic building faces certain destruction if $2 million isn't raised for repairs. The archdiocese says there's no viable plan to raise the massive amount of funds

The interior of Our Lady of Lourdes showing a painted mural in the back of the church

The church in its present form was built in 1916 and moved across a street by 50 men and horses in 1929

The Archdiocese of Chicago told CBS News that attendance at the church's Sunday masses have steadily declined.

The church simultaneously needs $2 million worth of repairs and without the community's support its likely it will be demolished.

There are a group of parishioners including Hilda Correa who are desperately trying to save the famed religious landmark. Correa and others say the church attracts tourists both Christian and non-Christian.

Correa also alluded to the fact that times are hard. Although she didn't specify what she was talking about - perhaps the years-long pandemic or stubborn inflation - Correa says the church is a place of comfort for those who come to visit.

Hilda Correa left and Julie Sawacki right as well as a number of others passionate about keeping Our Lady of Lourdes alive made impassioned pleas on the steps of the church before its last service on May 19

The wooden pews of the church are seen along with the altar and the mural above

A close up of the mural which represents 'The Blessing of Our Lady of Lourdes'

The church altar is pictured which sits just below the mural

A cross that sits atop one of the church's steeples.

'The religious aspect is really what's really touching us because losing such a valuable place that people can come especially in these days...'

Our Lady of Lourdes will be holding its final service on May 19 but Preservation Chicago a non-profit organization dedicated to saving city landmarks plans to revive the church and make it into a holy shrine.

'The effort here will probably be long and labored perhaps. There's a lot of different moving parts and a lot of different factors' said Preservation Chicago Executive Director Ward Miller.

There is a Change.org petition with 1107 signatures to preserve the church as a historical landmark rather than knocking it down. The goal is to reach 1500 signatures.

Name: Cincinnati Financial
Name_1: Mazunte and Karrikin Spirits Release New Drink
Text_1:
Margarita lovers can now take Mazunte‚Äôs version home with them thanks to the restaurant‚Äôs recently announced collaboration with Karrikin Spirits.

PHOTOGRAPH PROVIDED BY MAZUNTE

The new canned cocktail was developed using Mazunte‚Äôs classic margarita recipe using Karrikin‚Äôs Blaze which is fermented and distilled locally from 100 percent Blue Weber agave nectar imported from Jalisco Mexico. It also features Karrikin‚Äôs homemade Triple Sec.

‚ÄúWe had been discussing and exploring the best way to grow our brand by finding a way to offer our margarita outside of our brick-and-mortar locations‚Äù says John Johnston chief financial officer of Mazunte Taqueria Mazunte Centro and Mazunte Catering. ‚ÄúThis is difficult with us not being a distiller or alcohol distributor.‚Äù

Enter Jeff Hunt from Karrikin. The Fairfax-based craft distillery‚Äôs cofounder Johnston and Josh Wamsley Mazunte‚Äôs chief executive officer put their heads together to bring the product to fruition. The result is an elevated product with better ingredients Johnston notes.

‚ÄúWe hope this product is an extension of our brand through retail outlets with a new product offering to our current and new customers‚Äù he adds. ‚Äú[And] the nice part for them is they have an immediate large customer in us with our two restaurant locations.‚Äù

The canned margarita will be sold as a four pack of 12-ounce cans for a suggested retail price of $13.99. Karrikin and Ohio Valley Wine & Beer will act as distributors to retail outlets.

You can celebrate the release with the Mazunte crew this weekend during a release party from 2 to 10 p.m. on Saturday Sept. 10 at Karrikin Spirits (3717 Jonlen Dr. Fairfax). In addition Mazunte will have a pop-up ‚Äúmercado‚Äù for guests to take home tostada chips salsas guacamole meats and produce.
Name_2: Who was Bed Bath & Beyond's Gustavo Arnal: Exec worked for companies across globe
Text_2:
The top-level Bed Bath & Beyond executive who apparently jumped off a Tribeca high-rise was a well-regarded businessman whose career spanned the globe before his sudden death on Friday.

Gustavo Arnal was hired by Bed Bath & Beyond in May 2020 and credited with helping get the New Jersey-based retail giant through the worst of the COVID-19 pandemic the company said in a statement Sunday.

The exec came aboard as chief financial officer and executive vice president after ‚Äúa distinguished global career in finance‚Äù that included working at ‚Äúseveral other well-known businesses‚Äù the company stated Sunday.

Arnal came from cosmetic company Avon where he was also named the executive vice president and CFO starting in spring 2019 according to the Cincinnati Business Courier. He was at Walgreens Boots Alliance before that serving as senior vice president and CFO of international divisions and global functions the Business Courier said.

Both of those gigs were based in London.

6 Gustavo Arnal was hired by Bed Bath & Beyond in 2020.

6 The city medical examiner removes the body from New York Law School Building at the Church Street freight entrance. Robert Miller

6 The jumper was identified as Gustavo Arnal the CFO of Bed Bath & Beyond. Robert Miller

But most of his career was at Procter & Gamble where he spent 20 years holding various positions and working with brand names including Pringles potato chips and Tide detergent.

The husband and father of two adult daughters was CFO of the company‚Äôs India Middle East and Africa business where he oversaw operations in more than 50 countries the Cleveland Business Journal reported in May 2020.

When Arnal was announced as Bed Bath & Beyond‚Äôs newest hire he said the company had to build ‚Äúon the strong foundations of this business with a new robust and sustainable business model‚Äù the Cleveland Business Journal reported.

He also reportedly said he looked forward to working as a ‚Äúcatalyst for the cultural and financial change in the business.‚Äù

But the housewares company has struggled mightily recently and is expected to close 150 stores and terminate 20% of its workforce after an announcement about its restructuring came days before his death.

6 The tragic incident occurred at a residential building at 56 Leonard St. Robert Miller

6 The CFO wanted to be the ‚Äúcatalyst for the cultural and financial change in the business.‚Äù Robert Miller

Arnal was also included in a recent lawsuit that accuses him Chewy.com founder Ryan Cohen and others of artificially inflating the retail‚Äôs share price.

The class action was filed Aug. 23 in Washington DC.

The company‚Äôs board of directors chairman Harriet Edelman said in part of a statement Sunday about the shocking death ‚ÄúOur focus is on supporting his family and his team and our thoughts are with them during this sad and difficult time. Please join us in respecting the family‚Äôs privacy.‚Äù

6 Arnal was a husband and father of two daughters. Facebook/Gustavo Arnal

Arnal graduated from Sim√≥n Bol√≠var University of Venezuela with a mechanical engineering degree and got his master‚Äôs degree in finance from the Metropolitan University of Caracas the multilingual news site swissinfo.ch reported.

If you are struggling with suicidal thoughts or are experiencing a mental health crisis and live in New York City you can call 1-888-NYC-WELL for free and confidential crisis counseling. If you live outside the five boroughs you can dial the 24/7 National Suicide Prevention hotline at 988 or go to SuicidePreventionLifeline.org.

Name: Cintas
Name_1: Konser Bertalu Rindu Cinta sukses lepas rindu Iwan Fals dan penggemar
Text_1:
Konser Bertalu Rindu Cinta sukses lepas rindu Iwan Fals dan penggemar

Musisi Iwan Fals (memegang gitar depan) tampil di konser Bertalu Rindu "Cinta" di kawasan Leuwinanggung Depok Jawa Barat Sabtu (3/9/2022). (ANTARA/HO)

Musisi Iwan Fals (memegang gitar depan) tampil di konser Bertalu Rindu "Cinta" di kawasan Leuwinanggung Depok Jawa Barat Sabtu (3/9/2022). (ANTARA/HO)

Jakarta (ANTARA) - Konser "Bertalu Rindu 'Cinta'" yang digelar dalam rangka merayakan hari ulang tahun ke-61 Iwan Fals sukses menjadi ajang melepas rindu sang musisi dengan para penggemar setelah "hiatus" selama dua tahun akibat pandemi COVID-19Konser yang dipersiapkan khusus oleh sang istri Rossana Listanto itu digelar di kediaman Iwan Fals di kawasan Leuwinanggung Depok Jawa Barat dan dihadiri oleh ribuan penggemar yang tergabung dalam OI (Orang Indonesia)."Ini menjadi ajang silaturahmi melepas rindu dengan kalian semua" ucap Iwan Fals di sela-sela penampilannya" Sabtu.Suasana konser terasa hangat dan penuh kekeluargaan terlihat dari banyaknya penggemar yang membawa serta istri dan anak-anak mereka.Suasana semakin semarak kala setlist yang dibawakan diisi oleh lagu-lagu lawas yang jarang dinyanyikan oleh Iwan Fals sehingga berhasil melempar memori para penggemar ke masa-masa keemasan sang legenda.Belakangan diketahui bahwa setlist tersebut dipersiapkan khusus oleh Rossana atau yang akrab disapa Yos untuk memberikan sesuatu yang spesial di hari ulang tahun suaminya.Konser dibuka dengan lagu berjudul "11 Juli 1996" yang berasal dari album Suara Hati yang dirilis pada 2002. Selanjutnya Iwan membawakan dua lagu lainnya dari album tersebut masing-masing berjudul "Di Ujung Abad" dan "Untuk Para Pengabdi".Sorak sorai penonton semakin bergemuruh tatkala Iwan Fals memainkan lagu-lagu lawas seperti "Sumbang" "PHK" "Nyanyian Para Preman" "Potret" "Asmara Tak Secengeng Yang Aku Kira" hingga "Yakinlah".Disela-sela konser tanpa dikomandoi para penggemar menyanyikan lagu "Selamat Ulang Tahun" yang disambut dengan senyuman dari pria kelahiran 3 September 1961 itu.Iwan lalu menyebut beberapa nama musisi yang juga berulang tahun di tanggal dan bulan yang sama dengannya salah satunya gitaris Slank Ridho Hafiedz.Energi Iwan Fals masih terlihat prima di usianya yang sudah menginjak kepala enam. Hal itu nampak ketika dia menyanyikan lagu "Air Mata Api" dan "Cinta" dengan penuh semangat. Nada-nada tinggi dipadu irama cepat masih bisa dia nyanyikan dengan sempurna.Lengkingan-lengkingan khasnya sukses membangkitkan gairah ribuan penggemar untuk semakin lantang bernyanyi.Lagu-lagu lainnya yang dibawakan penyanyi bernama asli Virgiawan Listanto itu yakni "Aku Sayang Kamu" "Serenade" "Esek-esek Udug-udug" "Nyanyian Jiwa" dan "Kesaksian". Total sebanyak 16 lagu dibawakan di konser yang diselenggarakan oleh Tiga Rambu bekerjasama dengan Loket.com itu.Tampil sebagai musisi pendukung Iwan Fals adalah Ardy Sikki (bass) Sugarda Wijaya Amiarsa (gitar perkusi dan keyboard) Otta Tarrega (keyboard dan synth) Zulqi Ramadhan (gitar) serta putra bungsu dari pasangan Iwan Fals dan Yos Raya Rambu Rabbani (drum).Di penghujung acara Yos didampingi kedua anak mereka Annisa Cikal Rambu Basae dan Raya naik ke atas panggung membawakan kue ulang tahun. Pelukan hangat istri dan anak-anak kepada Iwan Fals menutup konser yang berlangsung selama 25 jam itu.

Pewarta: Fathur Rochman

Editor: Ida Nurcahyani

Name_2: Aldebaran Kembali ke Ikatan Cinta Arya Saloka: Hai AL Ketemu Lagi Kita - Kompas.com
Text_2:
JAKARTA KOMPAS.com - Aktor Arya Saloka akhirnya kembali dalam perannya sebagai Aldebaran di sinetron Ikatan Cinta.

Aldebaran muncul dalam sinetron Ikatan Cinta episode 861 yang tayang di RCTI Minggu (4/9/2022).

Melalui akun Instagram @arya.saloka Arya mengunggah cuplikan sinetron Ikatan Cinta yang memperlihatkan Aldebaran sedang terbaring lemah.

"Hai AL ketemu lagi kita" tulis Arya Saloka dalam unggahan video itu.

Sontak unggahan tersebut disambut bahagia oleh para penggemar Ikatan Cinta.

Mereka mengaku kembali semangat untuk menonton Ikatan Cinta.

"OTW NONTON LAGI. TERIMAKASIH MAS SUDAH MAU KEMBALI. LUPYU FULL" tulis akun @hannaolyviam.t

"Omg! Semangat lagi nak tengok ikatan cinta. Yesssss! Aladin is back" tulis akun @_ftinibrahim.

View this post on Instagram A post shared by ARYA SALOKA YUDA PRAWIRA SW (@arya.saloka)

Sebelumnya Arya Saloka juga mengunggah video tengah terdampar di lautan lepas dengan caption "survive".

Setelah sekian lama Ikatan Cinta kembali muncul menjadi trending Twitter. Para penonton setia meramaikan dengan tagar #ikatancintaep861.

Sebelumnya Aldebaran dikisahkan pergi bertugas ke Amerika Serikat.

Namun sejak itu Al tak pernah kembali ke pelukan Andin (Amanda Manopo).

Aldebaran dinyatakan hilang dan diyakini telah meninggal dunia dalam kecelakaan pesawat.
Name_3: 5 Kondisi Ini Sebagai Ujian Cinta dan Kesetiaan Suami pada Istri Menurut dr Aisah Dahlan
Text_3:
Ilustrasi pasangan suami istri. 5 kondisi sebagai ujian cinta dan kesetiaan suami pada istri.

BANGKAPOS.COM - Ada lima kondisi yang bisa disebut sebagai ujian cinta dan Kesetiaan seorang suami terhadap istri.

Hal itu dibeberkan oleh dr Aisah Dahlan dalam sebuah video di akun instagram @parentinganaksigap sebagaimana dilansir Bangkapos.com pada Sabtu 3 September 2022.

Sejatinya seorang suami selalu mencinta istri hingga akhir hayat.

Begitupun juga sebaliknya istri tetap berusaha mencintai suaminya.

Namun dalam keadaankondisi seperti ini rasa cinta dan kesetiaan seorang suami akan diuji.

Hal itu sebagaimana dalam sebuah penelitian.

dr Aisah Dahlan menjelaskan lima kondisi yang dimaksud.

"Namun kenyataannya tidak selalu sesuai dengan harapan.

Ekspektasi istri ingin memiliki kisah cinta romantis ala drama Korea tapi yang didapat kadang sebaliknya" katanya menjelaskan fenomena yang ada.

Menurut dr Aisah Dahlan beberapa kondisi di bawah ini menjadi penyebab naik turunnya kadar cinta suami ke istri.

Jika bisa melewati rumah tangga aman.

Namun jika tidak bisa akibatnya bisa fatal.

Setidaknya dengan mengetahuinya setiap istri bisa mengantisipasi harus berbuat apa.

1. Kemapanan Bertambah
Name_4: Tak lama putus dari Alyssa Daguise Al Ghazali pamer foto bareng cinta pertamanya - Hops ID
Text_4:
Hops.ID ‚Äì Pasangan muda Al Ghazali dan Alyssa Daguise kabarnya tegah kandas di tengah jalan setelah sekian lama menjalin hubungan.

Sempat beberapa kali putus nyambung Al Ghazali dan Alyssa Daguise sempat dikabarkan akan naik ke pelaminan.

Namun rupanya setelah beberapa kali meminta tunjuk pada Yang Maha Kuasa hubungan Al Ghazali dan Alyssa Daguise tidak di takdirkan untuk bersatu.

Keputusan tersebut tidak membuat seorang Al Ghazali menjadi putus asa ataupun bersedih karena kabarnya ia telah menemukan cinta pertama yang sekaligus menjadi cinta sejatinya.

Baca Juga: Gemasnya interaksi Rafathar dan Rayyanza netizen: Pingin gigit deh

Baru-baru ini Al Ghazali telah mengunggah foto dirinya bersama ibunda tercinta Maia Estianty di akun Instagram miliknya @alghazali7 dikutip Hops.ID pada 4 September 2022.

‚ÄúMy first love‚Äù tulis Al-Ghazali pada postingannya

Dalam unggahannya nampal Al Ghazali dan Maia Estianty tengah kompak mengenakan baju hitam yang senada.

Baca Juga: Juteknya Marissya Icha saat bertemu Frans Faisal warganet malah singgung Nathalie Holscher

Al Ghazali dan Maia Estianty (Instagram @alghazali7)

Maia Estianty dan Al Ghazali sedang berpelukan erat satu sama lainnya seperti halnya dua orang pasang kekasih yang sedang di mabuk asmara.

Baca Juga: Usai podcast bareng Ustaz Abdul Somad Daniel Mananta diminta netizen undang ustaz ini

Al Ghazali seolah ingin menunjukkan pada semua orang jika selama ini orang pertama yang ia cintai adalah ibunya sendiri alias Maia Estianty.

Unggahan Al Ghazali rupanya menarik perhatian dari para netizen terbukti dari banyaknya tanda suka sebanyak 138.000 orang.
Name_5: Lagu Cinta Westlife yang Patut Masuk Wedding Playlist Kamu
Text_5:
Follow IDN Times untuk mendapatkan informasi terkini. Klik untuk follow WhatsApp Channel & Google News

Westlife merupakan grup musik legendaris yang telah melahirkan banyak karya. Di antara musik-musiknya yang nyaman di telinga lagu cinta adalah karya yang paling sering dibawakan untuk menghibur para penggemar.

Terdapat sekitar 10 lagu cinta yang cocok dimasukkan ke dalam wedding playlist kamu atau sekadar hiburan saat kasmaran. Kamu suka yang mana nih?

1. "My Love" adalah single album 'Coast to Coast' yang bercerita tentang kekosongan seseorang apabila hidup tanpa adanya pasangan https://www.youtube.com/embed/ulOb9gIGGd0

2. Dari album yang sama "I Lay My Love on You" adalah lagu dari Westlife yang berkisah tentang seorang pria yang begitu mencintai kekasihnya https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZnOAK04tJhc

3. "I Wanna Grow Old with You" single dari album 'World of Our Own' yang mengisahkan harapan untuk bisa menjalani hidup dan menua bersama https://www.youtube.com/embed/1WCIrw85zbQ

4. "When You Tell Me That You Love Me" adalah lagu tentang rasa senang karena kehadiran seseorang yang mengubah hidup jadi lebih baik https://www.youtube.com/embed/MwSL-57pNqM

6. "Have You Ever Been in Love" adalah lagu lawas yang dinyanyikan kembali dengan isi yang mempertanyakan apakah kamu pernah jatuh cinta https://www.youtube.com/embed/laDsOIO4Mew

7. Dari album 'Face to Face' "That‚Äôs Where You Find Love" merupakan lagu tentang perjalanan pasangan dalam menemukan jalan cintanya https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y6lwoUMgaVI

8. "Unbreakable" merupakan lagu Westlife yang berkisah tentang kekuatan cinta https://www.youtube.com/embed/azdesKO7r4Q

9. "I Do" adalah single dalam album 'Back Home'. Cerita lagu ini seputar seseorang yang meminta pasangannya untuk percaya akan cintanya https://www.youtube.com/embed/hNCKSS2E_yU

Name_2: No. 6 Hardin-Simmons mauls NAIA Wayland Baptist in football opener
Text_2:
Staff report

PLAINVIEW ‚Äì Gaylon Glynn threw for 298 yards and four touchdowns and Cooper grad Noah Garcia ran for two more plus had a TD catch from Glynn as No. 6 Hardin-Simmons blasted NAIA Wayland Baptist 79-14 in the season football opener Saturday at Bulldog Stadium.

Garcia a freshman transfer from Cisco College ran for 122 yards on six carries in his Cowboys debut including an 89-yard TD run for his first score.

Garcia Cooper‚Äôs all-time leading rusher also had two catches for 32 yards ‚Äì one a 22-yarder for a TD.

Wylie grad Gatlin Martin returned a fumble 20 yards on the game's opening possession and he caught a 7-yard pass from Glynn for another.

Another Wylie player Grayson Bearden kicked a 25-yard field to give HSU a 45-0 lead as time expired in the first half and converted all 10 PAT attempts.

Glynn who completed 17 of 24 passes without an interception also threw 39-yard TD pass to Kevi Evans and A.J. Hawkins ran for TDs of 7 and 40 yards for the Cowboys (1-0).

The Pioneers (0-1) trailed 58-0 before Damon Ford ran 32 yards for a TD with 7:16 left in the third quarter and Bryan Ponder threw a 28-yard TD pass to Kamron Williams for the game‚Äôs penultimate score early in the fourth quarter.

HSU amassed 642 yards including 332 passing while holding the Pioneers to 209 total yards ‚Äì just 82 rushing. The Cowboys also got interceptions from Tre Allen and Brock Bujnoch.

HSU scored on its first four possessions after Martin's pick for a TD and five of its first six drives.

The Cowboys have a bye this week before going to Wisconsin-Platteville on Sept. 17. Platteville also known as the Pioneers lost to Michigan Tech 23-13 on Thursday. The Pioneers play Bethel (Minnesota) on Saturday at Pioneer Stadium

Name_3: ComBank donates another 5 fully-equipped IT labs
Text_3:
The latest IT Labs donated by Commercial Bank

The Commercial Bank of Ceylon has extended the reach of its national IT education initiative to encompass five more government teaching institutions to which the bank recently donated fully equipped IT labs and where necessary conducted building renovations.



The latest beneficiaries of the bank‚Äôs flagship corporate social responsibility programme are the Kudagammana Maha Vidyalaya in Walpita Karunarathna College in Kotadeniyawa Thawalampitiya Maha Vidyalaya and Henepola Vidyaloka Vidyalaya in Mirigama and the Vocational Training Authority of Sri Lanka (VTA) in Rajagiriya.

The bank‚Äôs donations included computers and chairs printers and multimedia projectors. In addition the bank also invested in the renovation and expansion of the existing IT lab facilities at some of these institutions.



While the schools cater to students from grades 1to 13 and require IT labs to teach ICT which is a compulsory subject in the curriculum the VTA needed 10 new computers to ensure the continuation of the twice-weekly computer courses currently conducted for 30 students.



Beside steadfastly continuing with the donation of fully-equipped IT labs the bank which is one of the largest contributors towards IT education in Sri Lankaalso supporteda project to set up 100 classrooms that focus on the STEM subjects and is funding projects to set up math labs in schools and to enhance vocational training opportunities for students that do not qualify for higher education.



Additionally Commercial Bank is funding a 150-hour IT hardware course conducted in collaboration with the Academy for ICT Skills and Development and CISCO Networking Academy in selected schools. While the CISCO Networking Academy provides the course fee free-of-charge for the students the bank sponsors the lecture fee of the course. The bank has also supported the ‚ÄòIT Essentials-Instructor‚Äô certificate course for teachers at the CISCO Networking Centre at the University of Moratuwa under this programme.

Name: Citigroup
Name_1: Citigroup to Launch Financial Inclusion Efforts
Text_1:
Citigroup will be launching two pilot programs under the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency‚Äôs Project REACh or Roundtable for Economic Access and Change to help underserved communities get more access to credit.

One of the programs will get credit cards to those without credit scores and the other will assist small businesses with minority women or veteran owners to get credit. Participation in Project REACh is a part of Citigroup‚Äôs $1 billion in strategic initiatives to help close the racial wealth gap and increase economic mobility in the United States according to the company‚Äôs press release.

Project REACh already works with several banks like JPMorgan Wells Fargo and U.S. Bancorp sharing bank account data to approve more borrowers for credit cards.

The issue of the credit-underserved is a big one in the U.S. with around 50 million residents lacking traditional credit scores. Banks usually look at credit scores when reviewing applications for various kinds of consumer debt.

The Wall Street Journal (WSJ) wrote that information about an applicant‚Äôs income and spending habits can be as good a measure of creditworthiness as traditional credit scores.

Efforts to help the underserved have cropped up elsewhere recently including the White House debut of a new Economic Opportunity Coalition (EOC) to look at economic disparities PYMNTS wrote.

Read more: PayPal Mastercard Citi and Others Join New Economic Opportunity Coalition

PayPal joined in late July alongside other members like Mastercard Citi Bank of America Capital One McDonald‚Äôs Netflix and PNC.

The coalition will look into investments for communities of color while the Biden-Harris administration will also invest. The EOC will be working between public private and social sector organizations to marshal and direct resources.

The areas of focus will include investing in community development financial institutions (CDFIs) and minority depository institutions (MDIs) supporting entrepreneurs and minority-owned businesses more access to credit and better infrastructure and housing for underserved neighborhoods.

The goal of the Biden-Harris administration is to ‚Äúhelp communities recover address inequities made worse by the pandemic and provide more pathways to economic growth for historically underserved communities.‚Äù
